summary.para: The AquaSkin component automatically skins windows forms applications in a choice of styles to mimic the popular Mac OS-X graphical user interface.
In order to skin your application you only need to drop this component onto the main form of your application at design-time.
Using the properties available on the AquaSkin component you can determine what Aqua style to use, what forms and controls should be skinned and whether to apply translucent shadows to your forms.

Use the property to determine which Aqua style should be used to skin your application. Use the property to determine what forms or controls you wish to have the skin applied. The and affects the visibility and appearance of the form shadow.

member.summary: Determines if the component license should be serialized

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.Shutdown
member.summary: Manually shuts down the skin engine and disposes all resources.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ApplySkin
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the entire application, the application skin is restored using the current settings.
member.remarks:
You would typically call this method after a previous call to to restore the application skin.
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ApplySkin(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the specified form.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually apply the skin to forms, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ApplySkin(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually applies the skin to the specified control and optional child controls.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually apply the skin to controls, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.param: If true, then all child controls are affected; if false then just the control is affected.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.RemoveSkin
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the entire application
member.remarks: You can call this method anywhere in your application to remove the skin from all forms and controls. You can restore the skin at anytime by calling the method.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.RemoveSkin(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the specified form.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually remove the skin from a form, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.RemoveSkin(System.Windows.Forms.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Manually removes the skin from the specified control and optional child controls.
member.remarks:
You would typically use this method to manually remove the skin from a control, or when the is set to .
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.param: If true, then all child controls are affected; if false then just the control is affected.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.RemoveApplicationSkin
member.summary:
Manually removes the entire application skin including form shadows, restoring the application GUI to a non-skinned appearance.
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.remarks: You can restore the skin at anytime by calling the method.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.RestoreApplicationSkin
member.summary:
Manually restores the entire application skin including all form shadows.
This method can be called anywhere in your application.
member.remarks: You would typically call this method after a previous call to to restore the application skin. The skin is restored according to the current setting and any Tagged exclusions or inclusions.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ValidateLicense(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the license using the specified design mode

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Maintains render performance whilst setting the properties, and prevents any unnecessary skin painting until the method is called.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.EndUpdate
member.summary: Resumes skin rendering after painting is suspended by the method.

member.name: M:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.Refresh
member.summary: Refreshes the application skin using the current settings.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.License
member.summary: Gets or sets the component license, this method is not intended to be used by client code.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.Site
member.summary: Overridden, see

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.SkinMode
member.summary:
Specifies how application forms and controls will be skinned.
Use to manually skin forms and controls.
Use to automatically skin all application forms and controls.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.AquaStyle
member.summary: Specifies which style to use.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.TargetControls
member.summary:
Specifies which application controls will have the skin applied.
Use to skin no application forms or controls,
Use to skin only application forms,
Use to skin only application controls,
Use to skin all application forms and controls,
Use to skin all tagged application forms and controls,

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.IncludeTag
member.summary:
Specifies a global include tag,
any or whose value matches this string will automatically get skinned, regardless of the setting.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ExcludeTag
member.summary:
Specifies a global tag,
any or whose value matches this string will automatically have the skin removed, regardless of the setting.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.CustomBackgroundPaint
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable custom background painting, this only applies to the client region of the , and controls.
member.remarks: Normally AquaSkin overrides all background painting, when this option is enabled you can override a controls and methods in order to owner draw your own custom graphics.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.SkinCommonDialogs
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin the common dialog components, such as the , , etc.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.SkinSystemControls
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin all native system controls and dialogs.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.SkinFlatStyles
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin flat styles on controls that support the property.
member.remarks: If this setting is false then flat styles will appear as normal.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ToolStripStyle
member.summary:
Specifies what render style to use. Use to render toolstrips with skinned elements.
Use to render toolstrips with professional skinned colors.
Use to render toolstrips with a combination of system and professional styles.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ShadowStyle
member.summary: Specifies the shadow style to apply to all forms.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.TextShadowVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether to display any text shadow on controls and captions.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.ShadowVisible
member.summary: Specifies whether the form shadow is visible. The form shadow is a translucent drop shadow effect applied to all application forms.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.HookSystemDrawing
member.summary: Specifies whether to skin parts that are directly drawn by the OS platform.
member.remarks: This is an advanced feature that enables AquaSkin to skin custom controls and drawing.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.HookSystemColors
member.summary: Specifies whether to override system colors and replace them with the skin palette.
member.remarks: This is an advanced that enables AquaSkin to override the and replace them with the skinned palette.

member.name: P:SkinSoft.AquaSkin.AquaSkin.UseSystemFonts
member.summary: Specifies whether to use system fonts in place of the skin fonts.
